content.body:
> <@lucacasonato:matrix.org> It looks like api.csswg.org may be having some issues. My CI runs are failing on the fetch spec: https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/runs/5472598698?check_suite_focus=true

https://drafts.csswg.org/ was wedged again for hours yesterday, so I reopened https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/6528#issuecomment-1061553682 ‚Äî which hasn‚Äôt been re-closed yet, so I don‚Äôt know if that means they‚Äôre expecting it to break again or what. Anyway I guess http://api.csswg.org/ and https://drafts.csswg.org/ are likely using the same backend.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @lucacasonato:matrix.org
It looks like api.csswg.org may be having some issues. My CI runs are failing on the fetch spec: https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/runs/5472598698?check_suite_focus=true
https://drafts.csswg.org/ was wedged again for hours yesterday, so I reopened https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/6528#issuecomment-1061553682 ‚Äî which hasn‚Äôt been re-closed yet, so I don‚Äôt know if that means they‚Äôre expecting it to break again or what. Anyway I guess http://api.csswg.org/ and https://drafts.csswg.org/ are likely using the same backend.

https://drafts.csswg.org/ was wedged again for hours yesterday, so I reopened https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/6528#issuecomment-1061553682 ‚Äî which hasn‚Äôt been re-closed yet, so I don‚Äôt know if that means they‚Äôre expecting it to break again or what. Anyway I guess http://api.csswg.org/ and https://drafts.csswg.org/ are likely using the same backend.

In reply to @lucacasonato:matrix.org
It looks like api.csswg.org may be having some issues. My CI runs are failing on the fetch spec: https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/runs/5472598698?check_suite_focus=true
https://drafts.csswg.org/ was wedged again for hours yesterday, so I reopened https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/6528#issuecomment-1061553682 ‚Äî which hasn‚Äôt been re-closed yet, so I don‚Äôt know if that means they‚Äôre expecting it to break again or what. Anyway I guess http://api.csswg.org/ and https://drafts.csswg.org/ are likely using the same backend.

content.body: Do we anywhere have in any spec a normative definition of the term _‚Äúsame-site‚Äù_?
content.formatted_body: Do we anywhere have in any spec a normative definition of the term ‚Äúsame-site‚Äù?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Do we anywhere have in any spec a normative definition of the term _‚Äúsame-site‚Äù_?
Do we anywhere have in any spec a normative definition of the term ‚Äúsame-site‚Äù?

content.body: I thought https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-fetch-metadata/#sec-fetch-site-header used to have at least a clear normative definition for  the `same-site` value of the `Sec-Fetch-Site` header ‚Äî and used that when I wrote up https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66115532/what-does-the-sec-fetch-site-header-mean-why-is-the-origin-header-undefined/66228794#66228794 ‚Äî but now even that spec no longer seems to make clear what it means by ‚Äúsame-site‚Äù (at least it‚Äôs not clear for developers reading the spec, in contrast to anybody who might be implementing it)
content.formatted_body: I thought https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-fetch-metadata/#sec-fetch-site-header used to have at least a clear normative definition for the same-site value of the Sec-Fetch-Site header ‚Äî and used that when I wrote up https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66115532/what-does-the-sec-fetch-site-header-mean-why-is-the-origin-header-undefined/66228794#66228794 ‚Äî but now even that spec no longer seems to make clear what it means by ‚Äúsame-site‚Äù (at least it‚Äôs not clear for developers reading the spec, in contrast to anybody who might be implementing it)

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: I thought https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-fetch-metadata/#sec-fetch-site-header used to have at least a clear normative definition for  the `same-site` value of the `Sec-Fetch-Site` header ‚Äî and used that when I wrote up https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66115532/what-does-the-sec-fetch-site-header-mean-why-is-the-origin-header-undefined/66228794#66228794 ‚Äî but now even that spec no longer seems to make clear what it means by ‚Äúsame-site‚Äù (at least it‚Äôs not clear for developers reading the spec, in contrast to anybody who might be implementing it)

I thought https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-fetch-metadata/#sec-fetch-site-header used to have at least a clear normative definition for the same-site value of the Sec-Fetch-Site header ‚Äî and used that when I wrote up https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66115532/what-does-the-sec-fetch-site-header-mean-why-is-the-origin-header-undefined/66228794#66228794 ‚Äî but now even that spec no longer seems to make clear what it means by ‚Äúsame-site‚Äù (at least it‚Äôs not clear for developers reading the spec, in contrast to anybody who might be implementing it)

content.body: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/origin.html#same-site
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/origin.html#same-site

content.body: Andreu Botella: OK thanks yeah I had seen that. So I guess that‚Äôs the best we‚Äôve got ‚Äî but I doubt it‚Äôs going to mean much to the average web developer reading it.
content.formatted_body: Andreu Botella: OK thanks yeah I had seen that. So I guess that‚Äôs the best we‚Äôve got ‚Äî but I doubt it‚Äôs going to mean much to the average web developer reading it.

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Andreu Botella: OK thanks yeah I had seen that. So I guess that‚Äôs the best we‚Äôve got ‚Äî but I doubt it‚Äôs going to mean much to the average web developer reading it.
Andreu Botella: OK thanks yeah I had seen that. So I guess that‚Äôs the best we‚Äôve got ‚Äî but I doubt it‚Äôs going to mean much to the average web developer reading it.

content.body: That seems to be the normative definition. I agree that it's not great for average devs
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: That seems to be the normative definition. I agree that it's not great for average devs

content.body: ‚Ä¶it doesn‚Äôt even directly reference _‚Äúregistrable domain‚Äù_

‚Ä¶it doesn‚Äôt even directly reference ‚Äúregistrable domain‚Äù

content.body: I think the concept of ‚Äúregistrable domain‚Äù is very clear and intuitive to everybody, so I‚Äôm glad that was coined and we have that defined in (the URL spec) at least ‚Äî it‚Äôs been a big improvement over directly mentioning the public-suffix list and the ‚ÄúeTLD+1‚Äù term
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I think the concept of ‚Äúregistrable domain‚Äù is very clear and intuitive to everybody, so I‚Äôm glad that was coined and we have that defined in (the URL spec) at least ‚Äî it‚Äôs been a big improvement over directly mentioning the public-suffix list and the ‚ÄúeTLD+1‚Äù term

content.body:
by the way, I‚Äôm confused a bit by https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/origin.html#sites, where we have the term ‚Äúsite‚Äù defined as this:
> A site is an opaque origin or a scheme-and-host

‚Ä¶while ‚Äúobtain a site‚Äù, in the common case, reduces defined as this:
> origin's scheme, origin's host's registrable domain

content.body: Yes, I knew about the issue; CI reported it to me right at the end of the day. Unfortunately the API server runs tip-of-tree Bikeshed (and is running 3.7, the version that was having problems), so it was broken until just now when I fixed it.
